intro: Thelasis succosa, commonly known as the succulent thelasis, is a perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the warmer months. Its succulent nature allows it to thrive in dry environments by storing moisture in its thick, fleshy leaves. Thelasis succosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
